page.title: 12LANGUAGE IN DIPTON.
page.content:
"GEORDIE" by J.McNULTY.& L.CASSIDY. {If you are born & bred in Dipton you {will speak with a "Geordie" accent. {The following "slang" words are used {within the local dialect & are common {to the N.E. of England only.
Gannin = going. Nick off = go away Toon = town Clarts = mud. Yhem = home Geet = great. Howay = come on Hacky = dirty. Divent = don't Ganzi = pullover Hoy = throw canny = O.K. Hinny = dear wy aye = yes
{A survey of 100 men & 100 women were {asked this question;"Which slang word {or expression, do you think best sums {up our Geordie Dialect?" {The two top answers to the question {were;"Howay Man" with 23% of the vote {& "Hinny" with 21% of the vote.
